title: Martin Johnson (rugby union)
summary: Martin Osborne Johnson CBE (born 9 March 1970)[2] is an English retired rugby union player who represented and captained England and Leicester in a career spanning 16 seasons. He captained England to victory in the 2003 Rugby World Cup, and is regarded as one of the greatest locks ever to have played,[3][4][5] and one of England's greatest ever players.[6][7]
